private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg can be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
I coordinate with other agents through an orchestrator; I do not emit PDDL.
agent_1.goal: Contribute valid primitive moves for disks A–E that help achieve the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, D; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg can be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
I coordinate with other agents through an orchestrator; I do not emit PDDL.
agent_2.goal: Contribute valid primitive moves for disks F–J that help achieve the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, D; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I can move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg can be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
I coordinate with other agents through an orchestrator; I do not emit PDDL.
agent_3.goal: Contribute valid primitive moves for disks K–O that help achieve the target configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, D; right peg has (top→bottom) B.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the entire move sequence.
I remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, imaginary macro-moves, or any non-primitive actions.
I ensure the final sequence is fully grounded in legal Tower of Hanoi moves and respects agent-specific disk permissions.
consistency_auditor.goal: Verify and, if necessary, repair the interleaving of agents’ moves into a single legal sequence from the given initial configuration to the specified goal configuration while eliminating any shortcuts or illegal steps.

private_information: I integrate agents’ audited moves into a single globally ordered plan.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards (Fast Downward) solver.
orchestrator.goal: Combine the agents’ valid moves into one ordered list that achieves the goal from the initial configuration and generate the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards.

init.move_format: agent_i: move disk X from left|middle|right to left|middle|right

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) to O (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) A, D; right peg has (top→bottom) B.
Agents are restricted by disk authority: agent_1 ⇒ A–E; agent_2 ⇒ F–J; agent_3 ⇒ K–O.
All moves must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk may be moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
Primitive move syntax must be exactly: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 with peg names left, middle, right.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You generate only primitive Tower of Hanoi moves for disks A–E, strictly obeying the rules and your disk authority.
local_plan.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2, using peg names from {environment->init->pegs}. Only move disks in {environment->init->agent_disk_authority->agent_1}. Respect the initial stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks} and aim for the goal stacks {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Do not emit PDDL, macros, or placeholders; do not refer to future steps; output only concrete primitive moves.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You generate only primitive Tower of Hanoi moves for disks F–J, strictly obeying the rules and your disk authority.
local_plan.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2, using peg names from {environment->init->pegs}. Only move disks in {environment->init->agent_disk_authority->agent_2}. Respect the initial stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks} and aim for the goal stacks {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Do not emit PDDL, macros, or placeholders; do not refer to future steps; output only concrete primitive moves.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You generate only primitive Tower of Hanoi moves for disks K–O, strictly obeying the rules and your disk authority.
local_plan.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2, using peg names from {environment->init->pegs}. Only move disks in {environment->init->agent_disk_authority->agent_3}. Respect the initial stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks} and aim for the goal stacks {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Do not emit PDDL, macros, or placeholders; do not refer to future steps; output only concrete primitive moves.

audit.system_prompt: You are the consistency_auditor. You reconstruct the full state after each step, verify legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, enforce agent-specific disk permissions, remove bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., tokens, post-hoc penalties, macro-steps, teleports, repeats), and ensure every step is a valid primitive move.
audit.prompt: Given the initial stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks}, the goal stacks {environment->init->goal_stacks}, and the agents’ local plans, check and repair the sequence to ensure a legal, temporally consistent interleaving. If any move is illegal or ambiguous, rewrite or re-order strictly as needed to maintain correctness. Preserve the exact output format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Output only the corrected, audited sequence.

integrate.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You integrate audited agent move sequences into a single globally ordered plan that achieves the goal from the initial state while honoring all constraints.
integrate.prompt: Using {environment->public_information} and the audited sequence, produce one final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 with peg names from {environment->init->pegs}. The list must start from {environment->init->initial_stacks} and end at {environment->init->goal_stacks}, never violate Tower of Hanoi rules, and respect agent disk authority {environment->init->agent_disk_authority}. Favor minimality but never at the cost of validity. Output only the ordered primitive moves, one per line.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL and FastDownwards. You will produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards (Fast Downward) solver. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Create a PDDL domain and problem for a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with disks {environment->init->disks} ordered smallest-to-largest as {environment->init->size_order_smallest_to_largest} and pegs {environment->init->pegs}. Encode legality: only top disks move; cannot place larger on smaller. Include predicates and a single move action with appropriate preconditions and effects; ensure :requirements include :typing and any others you use. In the problem, declare all objects, specify the initial state from {environment->init->initial_stacks}, and the goal state exactly matching {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Target FastDownwards by using standard STRIPS-compatible constructs. Do not rely on derived predicates or numeric fluents. Keep agent responsibilities implicit in the plan text and do not encode agent-specific authority into the domain; the final execution plan is given in global_move_list and will be used externally. Enclose outputs within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
